sentences.en: British industry was sheltered from foreign competition by protective tariffs.
sentences.cn: 保护性关税使英国工业免受国际竞争影响.

sentences.en: He sheltered himself behind a door.
He sheltered himself behind a hedge.
However, Being remains self-sheltered and self-withdrawed, which is the inevitable concealment in the sense of ontology.
sentences.cn: 但澄明着的存在本身却是自身庇护-自身隐匿的，是存在论上的必然的遮蔽。

sentences.en: In contrast, the lives of girls in well-to-do families were often very sheltered.
sentences.cn: 相反，生活在富裕家庭的女孩子通常都备受呵护。

sentences.en: Many old people choose to live in sheltered accommodation.
sentences.cn: 许多老年人选择到养老院居住.

sentences.en: My mother, who had a sheltered upbringing, has fantastic memories of childhood.
sentences.cn: 我妈妈在呵护下长大，对童年有着非常美好的回忆。

sentences.en: Perhaps I've just led a really sheltered life.
sentences.cn: 也许我一直过的就是一种呵护备至的生活。

sentences.en: The boulder sheltered them from the chilling wind.
sentences.cn: 那块大石头替他们挡住了寒风。

sentences.en: The climbers rested on a sheltered ledge jutting out from the cliff.
sentences.cn: 登山者在悬崖的岩棚上休息.

sentences.en: The farmyard was snugly sheltered with buildings on three sides.
sentences.cn: 这个农家院三面都有楼房,遮得很严实.

sentences.en: The hotel is situated on the sheltered shores of the Moray Firth.
sentences.cn: 旅馆位于马里湾的下风岸.

sentences.en: The island is normally protected from extreme weather conditions by its sheltered location in the Inner Hebrides.
sentences.cn: 这个岛自身位于内赫布里底群岛的掩蔽位置，通常能够抵御极端天气。

sentences.en: These plants must be sheltered from direct sunlight.
sentences.cn: 必须使这些植物不受阳光照射.

sentences.en: to have had a sheltered upbringing
We sheltered under a tree until the shower passed.
sentences.cn: 我们在树下躲雨,直到雨过天晴.

words.tran_cn: 受保护的；掩蔽的；免税的；为弱者提供方便的

phrases.tran_cn: n. 防空洞；防空壕；防空避难处
n. （美）（保护农作物的）防护林带
避税的合法手段；避税项目
临时避难所；临时收容中心；临时安置所；临时庇护站

trans.tran_cn: 受庇护的，免税的，（尤指为病弱者）提供食宿的，提供抚养方便的
庇护( shelter的过去式和过去分词)
